alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 12 at 8:16PM AKDT until March 13 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Blow snow with low visibility and very cold wind chills. Visibility less than one half mile at times. Wind chills to 50 below. North winds gusting to 40 mph. * WHERE...In Passes of the Southeastern Brooks Range. * WHEN...Until 10 AM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult. Blowing snow is causing low visibility. Snow drifts will form. The dangerously cold wind chills to 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds and worst conditions are in Brooks Range Passes. Winds will decrease after midnight and blowing snow will begin to improve, but very cold wind chills will continue into Monday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
